origination.corpname: University of Michigan. School of Business Administration.

did.unittitle: Ross School of Business Administration (University of Michigan) Publications
did.abstract: Includes addresses, annual reports, bibliographies, brochures and pamphlets, bulletins and college catalogs, directories, manuals, newsletters, programs, proposals, reports, statistics, and yearbooks. Also contains publications from the Bureau of Business Research, Center for International Business Education, Division of Research, Executive Education Center, Program in International Business and the Public Utility Executive Program. Also includes conference publications from meetings held at the university and sponsored or co-sponsored by the School of Business Administration. There are also some publications describing various development campaigns and the Summer Session. Also includes the publication entitled "Dividend". Some publications (or their successors) may no longer be available in print. but are available the school's website.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records of the Ross School of Business were received in three major accessions, 1980, 1983 and 1993. Donor no. 6468.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: page(s), folder/publication title, box no., Ross School of Business Administration (University of Michigan) Publications, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: See the finding aid for the Ross School of Business (University of Michigan) Records for a historical sketch of the Business School.

scopecontent.p: The Ross School of Business Publications, 1925-1998, and are divided into four series: Unit Publications, Sub-Unit Publications, Topical Publications and Student Organization Publications. The publications include addresses, annual reports, bibliographies, brochures and pamphlets, bulletins and college catalogs, directories, manuals, newsletters, programs, proposals, reports, statistics, and yearbooks. Also contains publications from the Bureau of Business Research, Center for International Business Education, Division of Research, Executive Education Center, Program in International Business and the Public Utility Executive Program. Also includes conference publications from meetings held at the university and sponsored or co-sponsored by the Ross School of Business Administration. There are also some publications describing various development campaigns and the Summer Session. Also includes the publication entitled "Dividend". Some publications (or their successors) may no longer be available in print but are available on the school s website.

odd.p: (2004 Bulletin for the University of Michigan School of Business Master of Business Administration [MBA] and Masters of Accounting [MAcc] programs. Includes program requirements, degree progress regulations, grade policies, guidelines for academic counseling and course registration, and information on academic honors and graduation. Also details residency requirements, services available to students, and student rights and responsibilities. Does not cover academic rules and regulations for the global and executive MBA programs. This document is accurate as of October 2004.)

(2005 Bulletin for the Master of Business Administration [MBA] and Masters of Accounting [MAcc] programs at the University of Michigan Ross School of Business. Includes program requirements, degree progress regulations, grade policies, guidelines for academic counseling and course registration, and information on academic honors and graduation. did.unittitle: Archived Ross School of Business Website

scopecontent.p: The Ross School of Business Archived Website series documents the academic programs, accomplishments, resources, events, and people at the Ross School of Business. Content includes important news and announcements, publications (such as newsletters and course catalogs), and information about admissions, curriculum, degree requirements, faculty, and the overall mission of the School. The website series is arranged chronologically, with captures from 2002 and 2003 stored on CD. Starting in 2010, this archived website will be captured on a regular, ongoing basis as part of the University of Michigan Web Archives, hosted at http://webarchives.cdlib.org/a/universityofmichigan/.
